required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of New Specifications (38mm) of FirehawkTM in the Treatment of Coronary Heart Disease
clinical_study.official_title: The Safety and Effectiveness Evaluation of New Specifications (38mm) of FirehawkTM Sirolimus Target-eluting Coronary Stent System in the Treatment of Coronary Heart Disease: a Prospective, Multicenter, Single-group Study.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evalute the clinical safety and effectiveness of released specification (38mm) of FirehawkTM Sirolimus target-eluting coronary stent system.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: all patients implanted Firehawk stent of new specification (38mm long)

secondary_outcome.description: a composite endpoint of cardiac death, myocardial infarction related to target vessel (TVMI) and clinically-indicated revascularization related to target lesion (CI-TLR)

arm_group.description: Implantation of the released specification (38mm) of FirehawkTM rapamycin target-eluting coronary stent systems

overall_official.affiliation: Fu Wai Hospital & National Center for Cardiovascular Diseases in China

group.title: Treatment Group
group.description: Implantation of the released specification (38mm) of FirehawkTM rapamycin target-eluting coronary stent systems Rapamycin target-eluting coronary stent systems (38mm)

group.description: Implantation of the released specification (38mm) of FirehawkTM rapamycin target-eluting coronary stent systems Rapamycin target-eluting coronary stent systems (38mm)

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: In-stent Late Lumen Loss
outcome.population: A sum of 31 patients with 33 target lesions were analyzed by Quantitative Coronary Angiography (QCA). 7 participants did not participate in 9 month angiographic follow up.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
